info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 20 at 12:07PM CST until November 20 at 3:15PM CST by NWS Austin/San Antonio TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Val Verde.
* WHEN...Until 315 PM CST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1207 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Comstock, Loma Alta, Seminole Canyon State Park, Box Canyon, Amistad Acres, Devils River State Nat Area Del Norte, Bakers Crossing, Devils River State Nat Area Big Satan, Vinegarone and Pafford Crossing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON
